data.title: Library staff (The University of Manchester Library)
data.text:
Christopher Pressler, John Rylands University Librarian, Director of The University of Manchester Library and Professor of Collecting Practices

Professor Christopher Pressler is John Rylands University Librarian and Director of The University of Manchester Library. He has also held the positions of University Librarian and Director of the Irish Modern Archives Research Centre at Dublin City University, University Librarian of the University of London, University Librarian of the University of Nottingham and Librarian, Dartington College of Arts.

Read more

John Hodgson, Associate Director: Curatorial Practices

Responsible for the strategic development and management of the Special Collections; providing team leadership in the collective pursuit of collections-based academic, student and public engagement; providing team leadership in the development of digital imaging. Curatorial responsibility for muniment and charter collections.

Read more

Jane Gallagher, Head of Digital Special Collections and Services

Providing strategic leadership of the Special Collections Reader Engagement, Building Care & Operations, Imaging and Visitor Services teams; leading the development of policies and programmes for advanced imaging and digitisation; positioning Curatorial Practices at the leading edge of digital development. Curatorial responsibility for post-1500 religions and theology printed collections

Contact Jane by email

Maya Sharma, Collections Engagement Officer

Supporting engagement with the AIU RACE Centre's library and archive collections, working with students, researchers and lecturers as well as schoolteachers and community-based educators, to ensure that Black, Asian, ethnic minority, refugee and migrant histories and experiences are known and valued by all; working directly with community members and groups who wish to draw on the collections.

Contact Maya by email

Elisabeth Carr, Collection Care Manager

Ensuring that the Library’s internationally significant collections are conserved and preserved to an appropriately high standard and in accordance with best practice in major research libraries and archives; providing effective leadership and management of the Library’s Collection Care Team and its processes.

Contact Elisabeth by email

Elaine Sheldon, Senior Conservator

Responsible for developing and implementing passive conservation measures across Library sites, in addition to the conservation and preservation of Library collections.

Contact Elaine by email

Sarai Vardi, Senior Conservator

Responsible for developing and implementing passive conservation measures across Library sites, in addition to the conservation and preservation of Library collections.

Contact Sarai by email

Janette Martin, Research and Learning Manager

Providing strategic leadership for the development of innovative research and student engagement with Special Collections; supporting the development of the John Rylands Research Institute; leading the development of innovative public engagement with research arising out of Special Collections; Curatorial responsibility for History archives (social, economic, industrial and political history).

Contact Janette by email

Clare Baker, Collections Coordinator

Coordinating the work of collections assistants to ensure a holistic approach to the management and development of the Special Collections, and to project manage activities such as collection moves and cataloguing projects.

Contact Clare by email

John Gandy, Incunabula Cataloguer

Creating fully-researched catalogue records for all of the fifteenth-century printed books in Special Collections. Promoting the Incunabula collection within The University of Manchester and elsewhere to ensure the widest publicity and use of the collection as possible.

Contact John by email

Charlotte Hoare, Manchester Digital Collections Content Coordinator

Coordinating processes for imaging, metadata creation and import of researcher-generated content; liaising between Library colleagues, project leads in research projects and the University’s cultural institutions, to ensure that the creation and ingest of content is managed efficiently and that images and metadata adhere to agreed standards.

Contact Charlotte by email

Emily Tan, Exhibitions and Public Engagement with Research Manager

Leading the design, creation, implementation and evaluation of innovative and inspiring exhibitions and public engagement with research programmes, which connect public audiences to the Library’s world-class Special Collections and the research that takes place around them.

Contact Emily by email

Gemma Henderson, Exhibitions and Public Engagement with Research Coordinator (job-share)

Supporting the Exhibitions and Public Engagement with Research Manager in the design, creation, implementation and evaluation of innovative and inspiring exhibitions and public engagement with research programmes, which connect public audiences to the Library’s world-class Special Collections and the research that takes place around them.

Contact Gemma by email

John McCrory, Digital Exhibitions Curator

Supporting the implementation of Omeka S as part of the Manchester Digital Collections project, developing new online exhibitions using Omeka S, both in support of the Library’s ongoing exhibition programme and in order to support research projects and public engagement with research.

Contact John by email

Steph Seville, Exhibitions and Public Engagement with Research Coordinator (job-share)

Supporting the Exhibitions and Public Engagement with Research Manager in the design, creation, implementation and evaluation of innovative and inspiring exhibitions and public engagement with research programmes, which connect public audiences to the Library’s world-class Special Collections and the research that takes place around them.

Contact Steph by email

Jamie Robinson, Imaging Manager

Leading imaging activity and development to support research, teaching and learning and public engagement activity; developing the implementation of advanced photographic methods and liaising with researchers and curators to support and develop activities of Special Collections.

Contact James by email

Tony Richards, Senior Photographer

Advanced Imaging lead supporting research, teaching and learning, and public engagement with Special Collections using a range of imaging methods such as Multispectral, RTI and 3D Photogrammetry.

Contact Tony by email
